title: Custom Hostname for a Zone
description: Manage hostnames for your zone that are routed via CNAME.

links.title: List Custom Hostnames
links.description: List, search, sort, and filter all of your custom hostnames

hostname.description: Fully qualified domain name to match against. This parameter cannot be used with the 'id' parameter.

id.description: Hostname ID to match against. This ID was generated and returned during the initial custom_hostname creation. This parameter cannot be used with the 'hostname' parameter.

ssl.description: Whether to filter hostnames based on if they have SSL enabled

links.title: Create Custom Hostname
links.description: Add a new custom hostname and request that an SSL certificate be issued for it. One of three validation methods—http, txt, email—should be used, with 'http' recommended if the CNAME is already in place (or will be soon). Specifying 'email' will send an email to the WHOIS contacts on file for the base domain plus hostmaster, postmaster, webmaster, admin, administrator. If http is used and the domain is not already pointing to the Managed CNAME host, the PATCH method must be used once it is (to complete validation).
links.curl:

     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \

method.description: Domain control validation (DCV) method used for this hostname.

type.description: Level of validation to be used for this hostname. Domain validation (dv) must be used.

http2.description: Whether or not HTTP2 is enabled.

tls_1_3.description: Whether or not TLS 1.3 is enabled.

ciphers.description: An allowlist of ciphers for TLS termination. These ciphers must be in the BoringSSL format.

early_hints.description: Whether or not Early Hints is enabled.

bundle_method.description: A ubiquitous bundle has the highest probability of being verified everywhere, even by clients using outdated or unusual trust stores. An optimal bundle uses the shortest chain and newest intermediates. And the force bundle verifies the chain, but does not otherwise modify it.

wildcard.description: Indicates whether the certificate covers a wildcard.

custom_certificate.description: If a custom uploaded certificate is used

custom_key.description: The key for a custom uploaded certificate

method.description: Domain control validation (DCV) method used for this hostname.

type.description: Level of validation to be used for this hostname. Domain validation (dv) must be used.

http2.description: Whether or not HTTP2 is enabled.

tls_1_3.description: Whether or not TLS 1.3 is enabled.

ciphers.description: An allowlist of ciphers for TLS termination. These ciphers must be in the BoringSSL format.

early_hints.description: Whether or not Early Hints is enabled.

bundle_method.description: A ubiquitous bundle has the highest probability of being verified everywhere, even by clients using outdated or unusual trust stores. An optimal bundle uses the shortest chain and newest intermediates. And the force bundle verifies the chain, but does not otherwise modify it.

wildcard.description: Indicates whether the certificate covers a wildcard.

custom_certificate.description: If a custom uploaded certificate is used

custom_key.description: The key for a custom uploaded certificate

ssl.description: SSL properties used when creating the custom hostname

custom_origin_server.description: a valid hostname that’s been added to your DNS zone as an A, AAAA, or CNAME record.

custom_origin_sni.description: A hostname that will be sent to your custom origin server as SNI for TLS handshake. This can be a valid subdomain of the zone or custom origin server name or the string ':request_host_header:' which will cause the host header in the request to be used as SNI. Not configurable with default/fallback origin server.

status.description: Status of the hostname's SSL certificates

method.description: Domain control validation (DCV) method used for this hostname.

type.description: Level of validation to be used for this hostname. Domain validation (dv) must be used.

txt_name.description: The hostname that the certificate authority (CA) will check for a TXT record during domain validation

txt_value.description: The TXT record that the certificate authority (CA) will check during domain validation.

http_url.description: The url that will be checked during domain validation.

http_body.description: The content that the certificate authority (CA) will expect to find at the http_url during the domain validation.

emails.description: The set of email addresses that the certificate authority (CA) will use to complete domain validation

validation_errors.description: Domain validation errors that have been received by the certificate authority (CA).

message.example: SERVFAIL looking up CAA for app.example.com

hosts.description: A list of Hostnames on a custom uploaded certificate

issuer.description: The issuer on a custom uploaded certificate

serial_number.description: The serial number on a custom uploaded certificate.

signature.description: The signature on a custom uploaded certificate

uploaded_on.description: The time the custom certificate was uploaded.

expires_on.description: The time the custom certificate expires on.

custom_csr_id.description: The identifier for the Custom CSR that was used

http2.description: Whether or not HTTP2 is enabled.

tls_1_3.description: Whether or not TLS 1.3 is enabled.

ciphers.description: An allowlist of ciphers for TLS termination. These ciphers must be in the BoringSSL format.

early_hints.description: Whether or not Early Hints is enabled.

bundle_method.description: A ubiquitous bundle has the highest probability of being verified everywhere, even by clients using outdated or unusual trust stores. An optimal bundle uses the shortest chain and newest intermediates. And the force bundle verifies the chain, but does not otherwise modify it.

wildcard.description: Indicates whether the certificate covers a wildcard.

certificate_authority.description: The Certificate Authority that has issued this certificate.

custom_certificate.description: If a custom uploaded certificate is used

custom_key.description: The key for a custom uploaded certificate

ssl.description: SSL properties for the custom hostname

custom_origin_server.description: a valid hostname that’s been added to your DNS zone as an A, AAAA, or CNAME record.

custom_origin_sni.description: A hostname that will be sent to your custom origin server as SNI for TLS handshake. This can be a valid subdomain of the zone or custom origin server name or the string ':request_host_header:' which will cause the host header in the request to be used as SNI. Not configurable with default/fallback origin server.

verification_errors.description: These are errors that were encountered while trying to activate a hostname.

ownership_verification.description: This is a record which can be placed to activate a hostname.

http_url.description: The HTTP URL that will be checked during custom hostname verification and where the customer should host the token.

ownership_verification_http.description: This presents the token to be served by the given http url to activate a hostname.

created_at.description: This is the time the hostname was created.

object_definition.title: Custom Hostname for a Zone
object_definition.description: Manage hostnames for your zone that are routed via CNAME.
